alert.note: Alert for Sawyer; Washburn (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 11:19PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Washburn and southwestern Sawyer Counties through 1145 PM CDT... At 1119 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Shell Lake, or near Spooner, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Spooner, Shell Lake, Stone Lake, Birchwood, Edgewater, Sarona, Sissabagama Lake, Little Sissabagama Lake, and Angus. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive through flood waters. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for northwestern Wisconsin.
